title: Sticky Asian-style pork burgers
time: Hands on time 20 mins, 25 mins cooking time, plus chilling and defrosting
description: A delicious Asian-inspired burger recipe that is low in calories and makes a pleasant change from the traditional favourite.
ingredients: Bunch of spring onions, finely chopped
Small bunch of fresh coriander, finely chopped
10 ciabatta rolls or 3 large loaves, each cut into 4 sections
Shredded lettuce, sliced radishes and cress

method.Step 1: Place all the burger ingredients in a large bowl and mix well. Season with a little salt and plenty of freshly ground black pepper. Cover and chill in the fridge for 1 hour.

method.Step 2: Using wet hands, shape the mixture into 10 burgers. Place flat between sheets of baking paper in a rigid freezerproof container. Freeze for up to 3 months.

method.Step 3: Defrost the burgers completely in the fridge; this will take 3-4 hours. Mix the maple syrup, soy sauce and oil. Brush over the burgers. Heat a griddle pan or barbecue to hot and cook the burgers for 3-4 minutes each side or until well-browned and cooked.

method.Step 4: Toast the rolls. Top with chilli sauce, soured cream, lettuce, radish and cress. Add the burgers, more salad and the tops of the rolls. Serve with prawn crackers, if you like.
